'Asturias' (, , ), officially the 'Principality of Asturias' ( ; ), is an
autonomous community of Spain. It is coextensive with the province of Asturias,
and contains nearly all of the territory that was part of the Kingdom of
Asturias in the Middle Ages. The autonomous community of Asturias is bordered by
Cantabria to the east, by Castile and LeÃ³n to the south, by Galicia to the west,
and by the Bay of Biscay to the north.

The most important cities are the communal capital, Oviedo (Uvieo or UviÃ©u), the
seaport and largest city GijÃ³n (XixÃ³n), and the industrial town of AvilÃ©s. Other
popular municipalities include Cangas de OnÃ­s (Cangues d'OnÃ­s), Cangas del
Narcea, GozÃ³n, Grado (Grao or Grau), Langreo (LlangrÃ©u), 'Llanera', Laviana
(Llaviana), Lena (á¸¶á¸·ena), Llanes, Mieres, Siero, ValdÃ©s, Vegadeo (A Veiga) and
Villaviciosa (see also [[List of municipalities in Asturias|List of
municipalities]] and [[Comarcas of Asturias|comarcas in Asturias]]).

Asturias is also home to the Prince of Asturias Awards.
